question: The UNESCO World Heritage Site "Deir el-Bahari" is located in which country?
explanation: Deir el-Bahari is a UNESCO World Heritage Site which forms part of the Ancient Thebes with its Necropolis site, located in the Luxor city of Egypt. This is a complex of mortuary temples and tombs located on the west bank of the Nile River. It houses mortuary temples of Nebhepetre Mentuhotep, Hatshepsut and Thutmose III. In March 2020, archaeologists discovered a treasure chest and a wooden box dated 3500 years back from this site.
